article_title: Emerging Disputes Over Risk Sharing Under The ACA
article_text:
Emerging Disputes Over Risk Sharing Under The ACA

Law360, New York (April 18, 2016, 11:05 AM ET) -- Sandra J. Durkin



Ursula A. Taylor



Jason S. Dubner Just two years after the enactment of The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, challenges to the ACA’s risk-sharing mechanisms are already beginning to emerge. These risk-sharing mechanisms, commonly referred to as the “Three Rs,” are the permanent risk adjustment and the temporary reinsurance and risk corridors programs, the latter two intended to operate from 2014 to 2016. article_metadata.description: While the Affordable Care Act was the subject of political controversy and legal attacks even before its inception, challenges implicating the act's risk-sharing mechanisms — specifically payments made under the risk corridors and reinsurance programs — are a relatively recent, albeit not unexpected, development, say attorneys at Butler Rubin Saltarelli & Boyd LLP.
